title: House Republican McHenry Asks for Details on Fed Balance-Sheet Operations
text:
WASHINGTON—The top Republican on the House Financial Services Committee is seeking more details about the Federal Reserve’s plan to expand its asset portfolio and wants to know whether regulations played a role in recent dysfunction in very short-term lending markets.

In a letter to Fed officials on Thursday, Rep. Patrick McHenry (R., N.C.) asked whether the current $1.4 trillion in deposits that banks keep at the Fed, known as reserves, are sufficient to provide a buffer for the financial system in times of stress—and if...
